result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher D Maciosek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
DOC COLLECT
AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. 
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
No alcohol. No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Vehicle and firearm may be returned to the prospective owners upon proof of ownership.

BOND QUASHED

Defendant Christopher D Maciosek in court, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by JJ Crawford.  Attorney Anthony N Flitcroft in court for Christopher D Maciosek. Called @ 1:19 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for plea and sentencing as to both files - 22CF136 & 22CT135.  Atty. Flitcroft responds to Court's questions regarding plea and agreement. Defendant responds to questions of the Court regarding plea.
On 22CF136:
Defendant pleads GUILTY to Count #1.  Counts #2 & #3 are dismissed and read-in. 
Case 22CT135 - Dismissed and read-in.
Court goes over deportation warnings, firearm restrictions, and voting rights. 
Atty. Flitcroft responds to Court's questions and makes further record as to joint recommendation. 
Court finds defendant's pleas to be knowing, voluntary, intelligent, and finds defendant guilty. Court adopts facts in criminal complaint. 
Record by the State as to sentence and asks the Court to adopt the agreement. Atty. Flitcroft joins in the request. 
Defendant does not wish to make statement. Court addresses defendant and adopts the agreement of the parties as to sentence.
**SEE ATTACHED PLEA AGREEMENT**
Court in recess.

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher D Maciosek in court, in custody.  Attorney Anthony N Flitcroft in court for Christopher D Maciosek. State opposes the return of firearms. Discussion regarding information being filed after 30 days. Defendant does not wish to start the case over. Minutes filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

2:01 PM (64-06) Defendant Christopher Maciosek appeared by video. Attorney Kim appeared in court for Christopher Maciosek. Andrew Herrmann appeared in court for the State.
State called to the stand as a witness, Police Officer from East Troy. Nicholas Schad.
Nicholas Schad duly sworn by the clerk and testified on direct examination by ADA Herrmann. Witness identified the defendant on the video. Exhibit #1 marked, identified and discussed.
Exhibit #1 offered and received by the Court.
2:04 PM - Cross examination by Attorney Kim.
State rests.
Evidence is closed.
Argument by the State.
Argument by Attorney Kim.
Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and that the defendant likely committed it and binds him over to stand trial on the charges. 
Attorney Kim acknowledged the receipt of the Information, waived reading, plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of his client.

2:23 PM Defendant Christopher D Maciosek appeared in court via video, Attorney Obi Uzowulu for Tony Kim for Christopher D Maciosek appeared in court, Plaintiff State of Wisconsin appeared in court. 
Attorney Uzowulu makes a record, defendant originally was going to waive his preliminary hearing, although now would like to have a hearing. State had cancelled their witness.
Court will reschedule the Preliminary Hearing.


Court finds good cause to toll time limits for rescheduling.

Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Christopher David Maciosek appeared in court, in custody by video with Attorney Leah Selmek. Defendant does qualify for SPD attorney. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Selmek. Bond set over weekend. State needs more time to make charging decision. Defendant is on ES hold. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Not to operate a motor vehicle without an IID installed. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
